availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Marietta Gouge Kendall in December 1835. Father of Elizabeth Kendall, Lewis Kendall, Phebe Kendall, James Kendall, Alfred Kendall, and Hayden Kendall. Farmer in Grant County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Grant County in 1850. Farmer in Grant County in 1860.Owned twenty enslaved persons in Grant County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 353B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 8.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000266220, p. 170.
Find A Grave, "Alfred Kendall (1811-1876)," Memorial 118761693, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/118761693 (accessed March 30, 2020).
